etymologies: mid 18th century; earliest use found in John Atkins (bap. 1685, d. 1757), naval surgeon. Origin unknown

definitions: A small elephant's tusk, used especially in the manufacture of billiard balls. Usually in plural.

notes.text: The maximum weight of a tusk classed as a scrivello ranged from 14 lb (approx. 6.3 kg) to 20 lb (approx. 9.1 kg).
